messages.message: @Weiming Wu With the community billing migration, are we using the `IB_<username>_billingUpdateNoticeSeen` key in localstorage to hide the billing modal? If so, we need to add some logic to Cypress to mock it to true, right? Otherwise, it will keep showing up since Cypress opens a new browser session every time. Is there a way to permanently hide this model?
There's no way to hide it right now. We should just add logic to mock it to true
Sounds good! So we'll see a bunch of test failures in the next run on aihub-sandbox?
For anything that uses an existing community account, yes :smiling_face_with_tear:
Where's a good place to place the mock call?

Probably do something similar to `waitForTrialLicenseCheck`.
I wonder if we should put the stub right inside `cy.login`? Less code change and easier to maintain
I like the `cy.login()` approach - it's directly tied to specific users and we can make this into a post-login action type of thing
yay! Thanks for taking this on!
Let me know when this is done, so that I can run the migration on the crafting cluster.
I merged it like 10 minutes ago. I think we should be ok to run the migration now
